p:
Even though we can fit A and b to data, recalling that
A = a exp ⁡ ( − c ⋅
t 0
)
, we have that an error in
c
propagates exponentially into an error in
a
, the upper asymptote that determines the final count of the epidemics. The same sensitivity test for the middle, and the first data point has shown very little variability of the logistic fits.
